page.title: 16NORTH HAMPSHIRE DOWNS
page.content: One of the attractions of Kingsclere is the Downs which rise above the village.There are gallops here which are used by{Park House}stables for training racehorses. One of the hobbies enjoyed in Kingsclere is{birdwatching}on the downs. There is a large variety of birds including owls. Another hobby on the downs is{hang-gliding,}and people also walk along the track, which is part of a{long-distance walk}across Hampshire. You can get nice views from on top of the downs towards Didcot with its power station cooling towers,in the Berkshire Downs. Many people use the two car parks by the road, and take picnics on the downs. { Watership Down}is the place which was the setting for the book and film of the same name.
